summary: This document contains Know Your Customer (KYC) information related to Jeffrey Epstein and associated entities, including Zorro Management, LLC. It details account ownership, the purpose of accounts, and the relationships between Epstein and his associates, including Darren Indyke and Stewart Oldfield. The document outlines financial details, including expected inflows and outflows, and provides insights into Epstein's wealth and business activities. This document appears to be a Know Your Customer (KYC) report from Deutsche Bank, detailing the risk assessment and due diligence performed on a client. It includes information about database searches, compliance checks, and the responsibilities of client-facing professionals in maintaining high standards of suitability and ethical conduct.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary individual associated with the accounts detailed in the document, including Zorro Management, LLC. He is described as the sole manager and owner of the entity.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Darren Indyke is mentioned as a signatory on the accounts associated with Jeffrey Epstein and is involved in the management of Zorro Management, LLC.

persons.name: Stewart Oldfield
persons.context: Stewart Oldfield is identified as the relationship manager for the accounts opened under Zorro Management, LLC, and has been in contact with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Cynthia Rodriguez
persons.context: Cynthia Rodriguez created the KYC case and provided comments regarding the research on parties involved.

persons.name: Andrew F Gallivan
persons.context: Andrew F Gallivan is noted as the Director/Business Head who signed off on the KYC documentation.

persons.name: Rafael Mercado
persons.context: Rafael Mercado is mentioned as a compliance officer who signed the KYC documentation.

persons.name: Yoonsun Chung
persons.context: Yoonsun Chung is also noted as a compliance officer who signed the KYC documentation.

connections.description: Darren Indyke is a manager at Zorro Management, LLC, which is owned by Jeffrey Epstein.
Stewart Oldfield is the relationship manager for accounts associated with Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein reached out to Stewart Oldfield on March 7, 2017, to open a new account under Zorro Management, LLC.
Zorro Management, LLC is described as a real estate holding company formed to manage activities associated with properties owned by Jeffrey Epstein.
The document outlines expected inflows and outflows for the accounts, indicating a monthly volume of $50,000 to $100,000.
Darren Indyke is listed as a signatory on the accounts alongside Jeffrey Epstein.
The document indicates that Jeffrey Epstein's estimated net worth is over $500 million.
The document is a KYC report from Deutsche Bank assessing a client's risk and compliance.
Cynthia Rodriguez created the KYC case on March 7, 2017.
Andrew F Gallivan, Rafael Mercado, and Yoonsun Chung are involved in the approval process of the KYC documentation.
The document emphasizes the importance of due diligence and ethical standards in client relationships.
There are references to various compliance checks performed, including OFAC and database searches.
